alert.note: Alert for Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:50AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Winona affecting Buffalo, Trempealeau and Winona Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Buffalo and Wabasha Counties. Mississippi River at Lake City affecting Goodhue, Pepin and Wabasha Counties. Mississippi River at La Crosse affecting Vernon, Houston and La Crosse Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Winona. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Some railroad lines may become inoperative. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to 18.3 feet Friday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.3 feet on 04/11/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
